solution_line_template: The number of students in the biology hall is twice the number of students in the general hall, meaning there are {biology_multiplier}*{general_study_hall_students} = <<{biology_multiplier}*{general_study_hall_students}={biology_hall_students}>>{biology_hall_students} students in the biology hall.

The total number of students in the biology hall and general study hall is {biology_hall_students}+{general_study_hall_students} = <<{biology_hall_students}+{general_study_hall_students}={general_and_biology_total}>>{general_and_biology_total} students.

If there are {math_hall_fraction} times as many students in the maths hall as there are in the general study hall and biology hall, their number is {math_hall_fraction}*{general_and_biology_total}=<<{math_hall_fraction}*{general_and_biology_total}={math_hall_students}>>{math_hall_students} students in the maths hall.

The total number of students in the three halls is {math_hall_students}+{general_and_biology_total} = <<{math_hall_students}+{general_and_biology_total}={total_students_all_halls}>>{total_students_all_halls} students
